page.title: 01General Background
page.content: { The D-Block covers an area generally known as{Kirkby-in-Furness.}It includes three hamlets which were mentioned in the original Domesday Book -{Soutergate, Beckside,}and {Sandside.}Basically, the roads link the three hamlets with each other and with the{A595}from{Barrow}to {Whitehaven.}Most of the houses stretch along the sides of the roads,although there are very few pavements. There are no housing estates, no blocks of flats, and no factories.To the North there is a marvellous view of the estuary of the{River Duddon}and the hills of Lakeland. Rising to the East are{Kirkby Moors,}while to the South can be seen the flat salt-marshes or mosses of the lower{Duddon valley.}The view to the West is over the estuary of the{Duddon, Millom,}a hill called
